questions.question: Whom ………………………. you want to meet?
questions.description: Use do with you. As there is no reference to past time, use the simple present here.

questions.question: What ……………………… you do then?
questions.description: Then shows distance in time. Hence, use the past tense here.

questions.question: Sam ……………………… not have a good job.
questions.description: Use does with a singular subject.

questions.question: Leena ……………………….. not want to quit her job.
questions.description: Did is also possible here however, since there is no reference to past time, use the simple present.

questions.question: How ………………………. they react when they heard the news?
questions.description: Here the subordinate clause is in the past tense hence, we use a past tense here as well.

questions.question: ………………………. you understand the consequences of your action?
Smoking …………………………. cause cancer.
questions.description: Use does with singular subjects. Does smoke means the same as smokes.

questions.question: That ………………………… not seem plausible.
questions.description: That is a singular subject hence, we use does with it. Did is also possible here.

questions.question: ……………………….. you meet him yesterday?
questions.description: Yesterday is a past time adverb hence, we use did here.

questions.question: At first she ………………………….. not recognize him.
My parents ………………………… not support my desire to become an actor.
questions.description: Either do not or did not is possible here.
